title: Tidy Tuesday 2021-03-16: Video Games and Sliced
description: For my first independent attempt at TidyTuesday I tackled a subject close to my husband's heart: Dota 2.
contents:
I recently attended a guided TidyTuesday hosted by RLadies Freiburg and wanted to apply what I had learned to a new data set. I went to the TidyTuesday Github repo. Once there I found the Video Games and Sliced dataset. This dataset looked interesting to me because (1) it was about gaming which is a topic often spoken about in my household, and (2) it was a relatively small dataset containing only seven variables.
In this post, Iâ€™ll first give a narrative summary of what I did. I include all the code and the final visualisation at the end of the post. You can find all the code at the TidyTuesday repo on Github.
First, I downloaded the data from Github using {tidytuesdayR} as indicated in the repo that contains the data. I soon realised you cannot keep downloading the data from online so I saved the data to a .csv file.


tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2021-03-16')

dat <- tuesdata$games

write_csv(dat, "data.csv")

dat <- read_csv("data.csv")



I next peaked at the data using View() and

title: Welcome
contents:
Hi!
Welcome to my blog. I described this post as introducing myself.
Who am I? In a bid to stop defining myself by my work, maybe I could say that I am a nature lover who does not get out nearly enough; I like to occupy my time learning new things, listening to audiobooks (Iâ€™m on an Enderverse binge at the moment), and looking after my indoor plants. If I did have to mention work, Iâ€™d say that I am a researcher and teacher. Iâ€™ve studied Linguistics, but my research currently fits more closely in the sub-discipline of Applied Linguistics.
I am hoping that this website will be a place for me to keep a record of what Iâ€™ve done and what Iâ€™m interested in. After getting a little more used to R I wanted to see if I would be able to make a website (and keep it running). Since Iâ€™m always having to Google the same things when it comes to my own analysis, I hope to also set up some posts to remind myself how to do things. Maybe this could be useful to you too.
Anyway, please get in touch if youâ€™d like to say â€œhi!â€. The relevant contacts are available on the home page.
